org.omnifaces.services.pooled

Annotation Type Pooled


  • @Inherited
 @NormalScope
 @Documented
 @Target(value={TYPE,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface Pooled
    Specify that a bean is to be pooled.

    Pooled beans can have multiple instances that are shared between all threads of an application, but can never be called by more than one thread at the same time. When a method call on a pooled bean is performed, an instance is selected from the pool and is locked until the method call ends. When performing multiple method calls directly after each other, multiple different beans may be used.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class[] destroyOn
      The types of Throwables which must cause the destruction of a pooled bean instance.
      Class[] dontDestroyOn
      The types of Throwables which must not cause the destruction of a pooled bean instance.
      long instanceLockTimeout
      The maximum amount of time to attempt to obtain a lock on an instance from the pool.
      TimeUnit instanceLockTimeoutUnit
      The TimeUnit to use for the instanceLockTimeout()
      int maxNumberOfInstances
      The maximum number of instances in the pool.

    • Element Detail

      • maxNumberOfInstances

        public abstract int maxNumberOfInstances
        The maximum number of instances in the pool.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of instances
        Default:
        10

      • instanceLockTimeout

        public abstract long instanceLockTimeout
        The maximum amount of time to attempt to obtain a lock on an instance from the pool.
        Returns:
        the maximum amount of time to try to obtain a lock
        Default:
        5L

      • instanceLockTimeoutUnit

        public abstract TimeUnit instanceLockTimeoutUnit
        The TimeUnit to use for the instanceLockTimeout()
        Returns:
        the time unit to use
        Default:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit.MINUTES

      • destroyOn

        public abstract Class[] destroyOn
        The types of Throwables which must cause the destruction of a pooled bean instance.

        If the pooled bean instances throws any Throwable which is an instance of a type set in the destroyOn property, then the bean will be destroyed, except if the throwable is also an instance of a type set in the dontDestroyOn() property.

        Returns:
        The types of Throwables which must cause the destruction of a pooled bean instance
        Default:
        {}

      • dontDestroyOn

        public abstract Class[] dontDestroyOn
        The types of Throwables which must not cause the destruction of a pooled bean instance.

        If the destroyOn() property is empty, but the dontDestroyOn property is not, then the bean will be destroyed for any Throwable that isn't an instance of a type in the dontDestroyOn property. When the destroyOn() property is not empty, then the dontDestroyOn property takes precedence. If a pooled bean instance throws a throwable which is an instance of a type in both the destroyOn and dontDestroyOn properties, then the bean will not be destroyed.

        Returns:
        The types of Throwables which must not cause the destruction of a pooled bean instance.
        Default:
        {}
